bestBHT.bht: We are assured of a reconstruction of human relationships and affections on a Christian basis, after sacrificing them on the altar of love for Christ. These promises are for those who forsake all for Him, receiving manifold more in this present time and eternal life in the world to come. This inheritance far surpasses any earthly enjoyments, offering comfort, peace, satisfaction, and pleasure that cannot be found elsewhere. It is a blessed assurance for those who seek to experience the fullness of God's kingdom in their lives.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: We have here the blessed promise of a reconstruction of all human relationships and affections on a Christian basis and in a Christian state, after being sacrificed, in their natural form, on the altar of love to Christ."
But best of all, 'in the world to come life everlasting.'
These promises are for every one who forsakes his all for Christ.
Archibald T. Robertson: Shall not receive (ουχ μη λαβη). Very strong double negative with aorist active subjunctive of λαμβανω.
Manifold more (πολλαπλασιονα). Late Greek word, here alone in the N.T. save Matthew 19:29 where Westcott and Hort have it though many MSS. there read εκατονπλασιονα (a hundredfold) as in Mark 10:30.
John Gill: Not more houses, parents, brethren, c. but that which is abundantly preferable to them such comfort, peace, satisfaction, and pleasure, as are not to be found in such enjoyments.
In the world to come life everlasting; which was what the young man was desirous of inheriting.
Manifold more in this present time....and in the world to come life everlasting.

bhtAttempts.bht: In Luke 18:30, we are given a promise of a reconstruction of human relationships and affections on a Christian basis, after being sacrificed on the altar of love for Christ. These promises are for everyone who forsakes everything for Christ. We will not only receive manifold more in this present time, but also life everlasting in the world to come, which far surpasses any earthly enjoyments. This is a blessed assurance for those who seek to inherit and experience the fullness of the kingdom of God.

We are promised a reconstruction of human relationships and affections on a Christian basis, after sacrificing them on the altar of love for Christ. These promises are for those who forsake everything for Him, receiving manifold more in this present time and life everlasting in the world to come. This assurance surpasses any earthly enjoyments, offering comfort, peace, satisfaction, and pleasure that cannot be found elsewhere. It is a blessed inheritance for those seeking to experience the fullness of God's kingdom.

We are assured of a reconstruction of human relationships and affections on a Christian basis, after sacrificing them on the altar of love for Christ. These promises are for those who forsake all for Him, receiving manifold more in this present time and eternal life in the world to come. This inheritance far surpasses any earthly enjoyments, offering comfort, peace, satisfaction, and pleasure that cannot be found elsewhere. It is a blessed assurance for those who seek to experience the fullness of God's kingdom in their lives.

We can find solace in the promises of a rebuilt society of human relationships and affections based on a Christian foundation, even after sacrificing them for the love of Christ. These assurances are given to anyone who forsakes everything for Him, resulting in an abundance of blessings in this present life and eternal life in the world to come. This inheritance of everlasting life surpasses any earthly pleasures and provides comfort, peace, satisfaction, and joy that cannot be found elsewhere. It is a valuable promise for those who seek to fully embrace God's kingdom.

We are promised a reconstruction of human relationships and affections on a Christian basis, after sacrificing them on the altar of love for Christ. These promises are for everyone who forsakes all for Him. We will receive manifold more blessings in this present time and life everlasting in the world to come. This assurance surpasses any earthly enjoyments, offering comfort, peace, satisfaction, and pleasure that are not found elsewhere. It is a blessed inheritance for those seeking to experience the fullness of God's kingdom.
